summary: Congress created the Opportunity Zones incentive to spur investment in distressed communities. Taxpayers who invest in Qualified Opportunity Funds—which invest in zones—can get significant tax benefits. According to IRS, over 6,000 of these funds invested about $29 billion in Opportunity Zones through 2019. The incentive attracted investment in housing, renewable energy businesses, and other projects. We testified that IRS developed plans to ensure these funds...
title: Opportunity Zones: Data on Investment Activity and IRS Challenges Ensuring Taxpayer Compliance
